item.title: Bitcoin Price Watch; Here's What's on this Morning - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Watch; Here's What's on this Morning - NEWSBTC

Here's what we are looking at in the bitcoin price this morning. After yesterday's steep decline in the bitcoin price, we got a period of drawn out consolidation thorughout Monday afternoon and early evening. The consolidation came about as a result of profit-taking on the short side, and likely, some counter positions being taken in anticipation of a long-term reversal.

item.title: Derivatives Leader CME Announces Bitcoin Benchmark Rates; NYSE to Follow
item.description:
Derivatives Leader CME Announces Bitcoin Benchmark Rates; NYSE to Follow

In a major move that is undoubtedly going to benefit and bring credibility to bitcoin and digital currencies, derivatives giant CME Group has announced the launch of two bitcoin benchmarks as its newest products. CME Group rival ICE (Intercontinental Exchange Inc) which owns the New York Stock Exchange, will also launch a real-time price index for bitcoin price.

item.title: Andresen Denies Hacking as GitHub Access Limited - Bitcoin News
item.description:
Andresen Denies Hacking as GitHub Access Limited - Bitcoin News

Amid speculation surrounding Dr. Craig Wright's claim to be Satoshi Nakamoto, Core developer Gavin Andresen has lost his Bitcoin commit privileges on GitHub. Also read: Industry Heavy Hitters Reveal the 'Real Satoshi' Andresen earlier released a blog entry stating his belief that Wright is the man behind the Satoshi Nakamoto pseudonym, which caused immediate controversy, with many suspecting Andresen had been hacked.

item.title: IPayYou Bitcoin Wallet Lets Users Cancel Transactions
item.description:
IPayYou Bitcoin Wallet Lets Users Cancel Transactions

Although these two features are appealing in their own right, the company plans to bring other types of functionality to IPayYou in the coming months. Bitcoin wallet solutions are plentiful, but there is still a mental hurdle to overcome by novice users.

item.title: Bitcoin and Ethereum: Not Competitors, Future BFFs - Andreas Antonopoulos
item.description:
Bitcoin and Ethereum: Not Competitors, Future BFFs - Andreas Antonopoulos

Bitcoin and Ethereum: Not Competitors, Future BFFs - Andreas Antonopoulos Somewhere along the way, the digital currency ecosystem came to the conclusion that every altcoin must compete directly against Bitcoin, or die trying. That it was a zero-sum game, and all altcoins were designed to knock Bitcoin off the top of the mountain.

item.title: Bitcoin Product of the Week: Unichange creates Bitcoin Debit Card With Virtual Bonus
item.description:
Bitcoin Product of the Week: Unichange creates Bitcoin Debit Card With Virtual Bonus

Bitcoin Product of the Week: Unichange creates Bitcoin Debit Card With Virtual Bonus For those looking to spend their Bitcoin or Litecoin within the legacy banking systems of 99% of commercial retailers, the Eastern-European Bitcoin exchange platform Unichange has a new option for you.

item.title: Bitcoin Usage Case- Saving The Future of the Electric Grid
item.description:
Bitcoin Usage Case- Saving The Future of the Electric Grid

Bitcoin Usage Case: Saving The Future of the Electric Grid Those new to Bitcoin or the world of digital currency generally are a bit foggy on how a digital currency can be used in the real world. What can it do that fiat currencies and debit cards can not?

item.title: 5 Facts About Bitcoin Everyone Thinks Are True | HolyTransaction
item.description:
5 Facts About Bitcoin Everyone Thinks Are True | HolyTransaction

Well, let's answer to this once and for all... Cash transactions have the same level of anonymity and it is up to users to follow the applicable state laws. Also, Bitcoin is not completely anonymous as transactions are open and public thanks to the blockchain nature.

item.title: Myths - Bitcoin Wiki
item.description:
Myths - Bitcoin Wiki

It is not correct to say that Bitcoin is "backed by" processing power. A currency being "backed" means that it is pegged to something else via a central party at a certain exchange rate yet you cannot exchange bitcoins for the computing power that was used to create them.

item.title: British Government Considering Using Bitcoin Directly For Payments
item.description:
British Government Considering Using Bitcoin Directly For Payments

British Government Considering Using Bitcoin Directly For Payments Bitcoin has been making some real headway in 2016 as far as mainstream acceptance is concerned. Japan has directly sanctioned its use, and the Japanese people are using the currency more than ever before. Australia has given their own vote of confidence in the currency.
